definition: excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
paternal aunt/husband's sister/husband's mother (old)/nun/for the time being (literary)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child

sentences.english: Surgery was curative in 54 patients and palliative in 27 patients.
sentences.chinese: 行胰十二指腸切除術54例，姑息性手術27例。

sentences.english: We shouldn't be indulgent towards his mistakes.
Perhaps the point of water through rock; perhaps, the breeze can be indulged .
sentences.chinese: 也許水通過岩石點，也許，在微風可以姑息遷就。

sentences.english: The median time of survival may increase as patients choose more definitive, rather than palliative, treatment.
sentences.chinese: 接受更多療法的患者比姑息治療的患者生存率要高。

sentences.english: Like most Dutch people, she knew little about options in palliative care.
sentences.chinese: 與大多數荷蘭人一樣，她對姑息療法知之甚少。

sentences.english: To external appeases in no way compromises in no way.
sentences.chinese: 對外掛決不姑息決不妥協。

sentences.english: IF YOU tolerate this, your children will be next.
sentences.chinese: 你若姑息此事，你的孩子將是下一個犧牲品。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the choice of palliative operation for the carcinoma of head of pancreas.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討胰頭癌姑息性手術的術式選擇。

sentences.english: The so-called rewards and punishments should be clear that God also will not be tolerated or abetted.
sentences.chinese: 所謂獎懲要分明，上帝更不會姑息養奸。

sentences.english: Palliative care also could help cut spiraling medical costs, Smith says.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯說姑息療法可以讓患者省下一大筆醫藥費。

sentences.english: We can further empower the forces of rejectionism and hate.
sentences.chinese: 我們或許可以進一步姑息拒絕主義和仇恨的勢力。

sentences.english: An America that will not coddle tyrants, from Baghdad to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 美國決不姑息從巴格達到北京的暴君。

sentences.english: In his eyes, this amounted to self-defeating appeasement.
sentences.chinese: 無異於姑息養奸，自尋失敗。

sentences.english: Toleration of dishonest officials encourages corruption.
sentences.chinese: 對貪官污吏的姑息遷就就是助長腐敗。

sentences.english: It would be foolish not to accommodate the people who will decide who governs.
sentences.chinese: 這將是愚蠢的人不能姑息遷就誰決定誰管理。

sentences.english: In the early period of the war, America adopted the policy of appeasement.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭初期，美國對日本採取了姑息與縱容的綏靖政策。

definition: to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
